page.title: 06AUSTIN ROVER CAR BODY PLANT
page.content: The{Austin Rover}car body factory forms the backbone of the industry in{Stratton St Margaret.}It was opened in 1955 on a 54 hectare site but now covers a much larger area. In 1975 it employed over 5,500 men but now it only employs 2,500 men; this is due to modern technology i.e.robots, computers and a more automated production line.Currently it is building parts for the following cars: Metro, Maestro, Montego and all the Jaguar range.It has been known to make panels for Rolls Royce.The plant makes its own tools i.e.dyes and moulds.It is capable of producing over 666,000 panels per week. Heavy lorries carrying body panels are a familiar sight on our local roads. The plant is also involved with the new Japanese{Honda}factory being built at{South Marston.
